carousel_items: Psyllium works in about 12-72 hours for constipation.
It's important to take each dose with at least 8 ounces (a full glass) of water or other liquid (not hot liquids).
Mix powder well and drink right away up to 3 times a day (build up to this slowly), but not for more than one week.
Don't take Psyllium within 2 hours before or after taking other medicines. It may interact and affect how they work.
If you take Psyllium then have chest pain, vomiting, trouble breathing or swallowing, get medical help immediately.
Ask your doctor before taking Psyllium if you have stomach pain, nausea, vomiting or had sudden changes in your stool for more than 2 weeks.
Ask your doctor about giving Psyllium to anyone younger than 12 years.
Stop taking Psyllium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly, rectal bleeding or have not had a bowel movement after taking.
Talk to you doctor about eating certain foods and getting more exercise to help prevent your constipation.

basics.benefits_moa: Psyllium is a fiber-based laxative. It adds bulk and moisture to your intestine, which softens stool and makes it easier to pass.
basics.bottom_line: The natural psyllium fiber in Psyllium does more than relieve constipation. It lowers cholesterol, keeps blood sugar levels healthy, and makes you feel less hungry between meals.
downsides: You may have to take Psyllium daily for 1-3 days to see full effects.
If you don't take it with enough liquid, it could swell, block your throat and cause choking.
Not the best choice for people who have swallowing problems or aren't able to drink lots of liquids.
Psyllium contains psyllium. Don't take if you have an allergy to psyllium from breathing it in or swallowing it.
Can cause gas and mild belly cramps.

downsides_processed.orig: You may have to take Psyllium daily for 1-3 days to see full effects.
If you don't take it with enough liquid, it could swell, block your throat and cause choking.
Not the best choice for people who have swallowing problems or aren't able to drink lots of liquids.
Psyllium contains psyllium. Don't take if you have an allergy to psyllium from breathing it in or swallowing it.
Can cause gas and mild belly cramps.

upsides: Psyllium is the most recommended brand of natural fiber laxative
Some people feel that taking Psyllium is a hassle, but most think it's worth it.
It has multiple health benefits, good to control your hunger between meals, improves your blood sugar and lowers cholesterol levels.
Studies show it works better than a stool softener for constipation.

upsides_processed.orig: Psyllium is the most recommended brand of natural fiber laxative
Some people feel that taking Psyllium is a hassle, but most think it's worth it.
It has multiple health benefits, good to control your hunger between meals, improves your blood sugar and lowers cholesterol levels.
Studies show it works better than a stool softener for constipation.

drugs.name: Metamucil

carousel_items_processed.orig: Psyllium works in about 12-72 hours for constipation.
It's important to take each dose with at least 8 ounces (a full glass) of water or other liquid (not hot liquids).
Mix powder well and drink right away up to 3 times a day (build up to this slowly), but not for more than one week.
Don't take Psyllium within 2 hours before or after taking other medicines. It may interact and affect how they work.
If you take Psyllium then have chest pain, vomiting, trouble breathing or swallowing, get medical help immediately.
Ask your doctor before taking Psyllium if you have stomach pain, nausea, vomiting or had sudden changes in your stool for more than 2 weeks.
Ask your doctor about giving Psyllium to anyone younger than 12 years.
Stop taking Psyllium and call your doctor if you have pain, swelling or bulging in your belly, rectal bleeding or have not had a bowel movement after taking.
Talk to you doctor about eating certain foods and getting more exercise to help prevent your constipation.

risks_warnings.title: Bowel blockage
risks_warnings.description: Stop taking Psyllium and call your doctor right away if you have nausea, vomiting, pain or bulging in your belly that doesn't go away, have rectal bleeding, and no bowel movement after taking. These may be symptoms of a bowel blockage (bowel obstruction) which is serious.
risk_factors: Other condition that causes blockage or narrowing of bowel

description_processed.orig: Stop taking Psyllium and call your doctor right away if you have nausea, vomiting, pain or bulging in your belly that doesn't go away, have rectal bleeding, and no bowel movement after taking. These may be symptoms of a bowel blockage (bowel obstruction) which is serious.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Psyllium can cause allergic reaction and life-threatening organ failure. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Psyllium can cause allergic reaction and life-threatening organ failure. Call your doctor and get medical care right away if you have fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

carousel_items: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Naproxen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Naproxen works well for mild to moderate pain and inflammation, and it lasts longer than other NSAIDs.
downsides: It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain, swelling, and fevers.
Good for menstrual cramps, toothaches, body aches, and mild arthritis pain.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen, so you can take it less often.
Naproxen works as well as Aspirin and Indomethacin to treat arthritis pain, and causes fewer stomach problems.
Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to relieve pain, swelling, and fevers.
Good for menstrual cramps, toothaches, body aches, and mild arthritis pain.
Lasts longer than Ibuprofen, so you can take it less often.
Naproxen works as well as Aspirin and Indomethacin to treat arthritis pain, and causes fewer stomach problems.
Although not without side effects, it's been around for a long time and is generally safe for short-term use.

userStories.tip: Its best pain killer just concerned about long term usage ..

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: Was prescribed naproxen for shoulder pain and inflammation, twice a day for 10 days. Pain disappeared almost immediately. No discernible side effects. Hoping the effects will be long lasting after stopping the medication.
It takes about a day to kick in.
I take it occasionally for back pain.

Naproxen was great the first time I used it for a few weeks. But I unknowingly developed an allergy to it, so the next time I took it 6 months later, I broke out in hives and my face swelled up like a balloon. So I can't take it anymore.
userStories.identifier: physically active person with knee pain
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: Found it best to take with food.

drugs.name: Naproxen

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts relieving pain in 30 to 60 minutes.
Take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily and it can also cause stomach ulcers.
Don't take it with other blood thinners, like aspirin, unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Can hurt your kidneys, so don't use it if you have a history of kidney problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Naproxen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Taking the lowest dose that works for you, for the shortest time possible, will lower your risk of having this problem. Don't take Naproxen after having heart surgery for at least two weeks.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Naproxen, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Naproxen, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Naproxen. Don't take Naproxen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Naproxen.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise and bleed more easily while using Naproxen. Don't take Naproxen while using other blood thinning medications, like aspirin and warfarin (Coumadin). Tell your doctor about your medications and medical conditions before starting Naproxen.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Naproxen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Naproxen can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Lower kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Naproxen for any amount of time.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen is an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Naproxen for any amount of time.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Naproxen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Naproxen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

carousel_items: The dose of Prometrium will be different depending on what you’re using it for, so take it exactly the way your doctor tells you.
It's important to take it the same time every day.
Prometrium capsules can make you feel tired or dizzy, so take it just before you go to sleep every night.
If you have trouble swallowing the capsule, take it with a full glass of water while standing up.
Can cause cramps, bloating, trouble sleeping, acne, weight gain, facial skin discoloration, or irregular periods.
Tell your doctor about any severe stomach pain or yellowing of your eyes or skin.
Get immediate medical help if you have sudden vision changes or one-sided weakness (signs of stroke) or chest pain and trouble breathing (signs of a pulmonary embolism).

basics.benefits_moa: Prometrium contains progesterone, a hormone that regulates the menstrual cycle and protects the uterus from the negative effects of estrogen when used for postmenopausal treatment.
basics.bottom_line: Prometrium regulates menstrual cycles, treats heavy bleeding, and prevents thickening of the uterus.
downsides: Prometrium capsules contain peanut oil, so you can't take it if you're allergic to peanuts.
Prometrium can cause serious birth defects in babies, so you can't take Prometrium if you’re pregnant or breast-feeding.
Increases your risk of blood clots.

downsides_processed.orig: Prometrium capsules contain peanut oil, so you can't take it if you're allergic to peanuts.
Prometrium can cause serious birth defects in babies, so you can't take Prometrium if you’re pregnant or breast-feeding.
Increases your risk of blood clots.

upsides: Helps to regulate your menstrual cycle.
Lowers the risk of uterine cancer when used with estrogen in women with an intact uterus.
Available as a capsule or an injection, so you can choose what works best for you.

upsides_processed.orig: Helps to regulate your menstrual cycle.
Lowers the risk of uterine cancer when used with estrogen in women with an intact uterus.
Available as a capsule or an injection, so you can choose what works best for you.

drugs.one_liner: Taken for irregular bleeding or paired with estrogen replacements for menopause.
drugs.name: Prometrium

labeled_indications.indication: Prevention of uterine cancer in women taking estrogen

carousel_items_processed.orig: The dose of Prometrium will be different depending on what you’re using it for, so take it exactly the way your doctor tells you.
It's important to take it the same time every day.
Prometrium capsules can make you feel tired or dizzy, so take it just before you go to sleep every night.
If you have trouble swallowing the capsule, take it with a full glass of water while standing up.
Can cause cramps, bloating, trouble sleeping, acne, weight gain, facial skin discoloration, or irregular periods.
Tell your doctor about any severe stomach pain or yellowing of your eyes or skin.
Get immediate medical help if you have sudden vision changes or one-sided weakness (signs of stroke) or chest pain and trouble breathing (signs of a pulmonary embolism).

risks_warnings.title: Breast cancer
risks_warnings.description: It is not completely clear if progestin, like as Prometrium, increases your risk of breast cancer. There may be a higher risk if you have a history of breast cancer, so make sure to get routine breast exams.
risk_factors: Personal or family history of breast cancer

description_processed.orig: It is not completely clear if progestin, like as Prometrium, increases your risk of breast cancer. There may be a higher risk if you have a history of breast cancer, so make sure to get routine breast exams.

risks_warnings.title: Ovarian cancer
risks_warnings.description: Prometrium contains progestin. It could cause a higher risk of ovarian cancer, especially if you have a family history of it. Your doctor can help you weigh the risks versus the benefits of this medication.

description_processed.orig: Prometrium contains progestin. It could cause a higher risk of ovarian cancer, especially if you have a family history of it. Your doctor can help you weigh the risks versus the benefits of this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of blood clots and stroke
risks_warnings.description: Using progestin with or without estrogen can increase your risk of blood clots. Blood clots can cause pain and discomfort from a deep vein thrombosis (a clot in the arm or leg), or serious disability due to a stroke or pulmonary embolism (a clot in the brain or lung). Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.
risk_factors: Personal or family history of blood clots

description_processed.orig: Using progestin with or without estrogen can increase your risk of blood clots. Blood clots can cause pain and discomfort from a deep vein thrombosis (a clot in the arm or leg), or serious disability due to a stroke or pulmonary embolism (a clot in the brain or lung). Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Prometrium contains peanut oil and can cause allergic reactions (severe rash, itching, trouble breathing) or angioedema (mouth swelling). Call your doctor and get emergency care immediately if you notice any of these symptoms.

description_processed.orig: Prometrium contains peanut oil and can cause allergic reactions (severe rash, itching, trouble breathing) or angioedema (mouth swelling). Call your doctor and get emergency care immediately if you notice any of these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Fluid retention (Foot and leg swelling)
risks_warnings.description: Prometrium can cause extra fluid to build up in your legs, ankles, feet, and sometimes arms and hands. It can be mild to severe and may not go away immediately. Swelling can be worse if you have other medical conditions that increase your risk. If it becomes severe, talk to your doctor since you may need to stop taking Prometrium.

description_processed.orig: Prometrium can cause extra fluid to build up in your legs, ankles, feet, and sometimes arms and hands. It can be mild to severe and may not go away immediately. Swelling can be worse if you have other medical conditions that increase your risk. If it becomes severe, talk to your doctor since you may need to stop taking Prometrium.

risks_warnings.title: Depression
risks_warnings.description: Prometrium can cause depression. Let your doctor know if you have a history of, or are taking medicines to treat, depression before starting Prometrium.

description_processed.orig: Prometrium can cause depression. Let your doctor know if you have a history of, or are taking medicines to treat, depression before starting Prometrium.
